org.ff4j.cache

Class FF4jCacheProxy

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ff4j.cache.FF4jCacheProxy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FeatureStore, PropertyStore

    public class FF4jCacheProxy
extends Object
implements FeatureStore, PropertyStore
    Access to FeatureStore could generate some overhead and decrease performances. This is the reason why cache is provided though proxies. As applications are distributed, the cache itself could be distributed. The default implement is InMemoryFeatureStoreCacheProxy but other are provided to use distributed cache system as redis or memcached.
    Author:
    Cedrick Lunven (@clunven)

      • createSchema

        public void createSchema()
        Initialize the target database schema by creating expected structures.
      • TABLE, INDEX will be created for JDBC, but also COLLECTION and INDEXS for MongoDb, or COLUMN FAMILY for Cassandra.
      • The structures will be created only if they don't exist.
      • In some cases, there is nothing todo (Ehcache, Redis, InMemory), the method won't failed but do nothing (it does not clear the DB)
Specified by:
createSchema in interface FeatureStore
Specified by:
createSchema in interface PropertyStore
